reviews.review_msg: Exactly how I hoped university might be. A small, casual class, with a brilliant and friendly professor, where learning is emphasised more than midterms and exams. Two thumbs way up. The material is also pretty intriguing and neat to play around with.
Actually amazing, as long as you pay attention and do the assignments its an easy A. He does everything to help you succeed and makes these really complicated topics really easy to understand.

The most discouraging academic experience I've had. Explanations are unclear, questions met with condescension, and the environment feels hostile rather than supportive. Logic and set theory are already difficult, but this professor actively undermines students' confidence. Avoid if you want to learn.

Terrible lecturer. The workload feels pointless and unchallenging. Even though attendance isn't required, it's almost the only way to piece together what's going on, since the material isn't organized. He often uses bizarre, outlandish examples that end up being more confusing than helpful.
Professor Nicolas Fillion is incredibly smart & adept at teaching about logic. Encourages critical thinking in philosophy students to improve their arguments. Funny guy outside the classroom

Nic is an excellent professor, with an engaging lecture style and tough but fair grading criteria. He is more than happy to accomodate questions and is genuinely interested in course content. Nic is also quite the comedian, which facilitated an easygoing class dynamic.

Homework every week but it's fair. He actually cares about the his students learning. And his lectures are engaging. ASK QUESTIONS! He is more than happy to help you out. Hes also pretty funny. I wish all profs are like him.
Be prepared to cry yourself to sleep every week. The assignments are crazy

Attendance was not mandatory causing people to skip his lectures and then conclude that he is a bad professor. In actuality lectures were amazing and very educational. If these people rating 1 star had been in more than 2 lectures they would see that Nic is a very competent lecturer. Lectures? Captivating. Accent? Alluring. Appearance? Gorgeous.

Nic is an engaging lecturer who puts lots of emphasis on making the material fun and comprehensible. He is always happy to help you during and outside of class and does a wonderful job at creating a friendly class environment

His classes tend to require a fair bit of work, but they are relatively easy to do well in and you will learn a lot.
Nic is caring, compassionate, and helpful! I had a blast in his class and I really like how he makes us think hard. Also a very funny guy!

He is one of the most amazing, genuine, funny and caring human being I have ever encountered. He is always there to help and and will encourage you to seek out help if needed. It was such a difficult such but it was so worth it and will probably be one of the most memorable experiences of my undergrad journey!
His assignments make me cry

One of my biggest regrets in life is taking this class. I took this as an elective thinking it would be fun to learn but the information is too dense and his lectures aren't engaging at all. He goes really fast during lecture.

Rather than creating assessments that fairly test knowledge, Nic seems determined to make them overly complex and confusing. His focus seems to be on making the class as hard as possible, rather than ensuring students learn the material.

I am awful at logic, so when I first started this course I was pretty nervous since it was quite intimidating. I felt like I would fail this course, however, I started to attend office hours regularly and I drastically improved. This course will test you, but Nic is here to help and will take the time to do so if you work hard.

Nic is one of the most chill professors I've ever come across. Will give you every chance to do better. We could resubmit our assignments to get 50% of the grade back, how cool is that? The coursework gets challenging towards the end but if you keep up with the assignments and attend office hours, you are golden!

Suppose PHIL 310 is extremely difficult with long assignments and a brutal final. It follows that Nic's lecture are informative and hilarious, making the 3 hours fly by quickly. It also follows that he is caring and happy to help students during office hours. Therefore, Nic is one of my favourite profs and made me much more confident in logic.

He is a great professor with good and passionate lectures. However, a few chapters in the last part of the course on set theories are ridiculously challenging to understand and apply to the assignments.

Nic is an amazing lecturer. He really helped me understand the stuff on set theory. Though the class itself can be tough, Nic tries to make the intimidating parts of set theory not seem so scary (and they really aren't once you figure out how to do the proofs!). Definitely would take another class with him if I could. Super nice guy!

Nic is a real star of the Department of Philosophy! He is a creator of the new version of Phil 310. I really recommend to take this course if you had MACM or some logic classes before as it will be an easy A for you. The only problem of this course is lack of practical examples from the real world. But the lectures were perfect and reasonable.
